Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; exterior glazed streaky black; underside reserved.
Curator's comments: The thickness of the sherd suggests that the conical foot held a large chalice and given the size of the sherd, the foot was likely much larger. the foot is too steep to belong to a sherd in the early patterned and Wild Goat Styles but it may have come from a chalice in the Mature Animal Style, Grand Style of Chalice Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0686) (phase 2)
